717873f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Crosby Street
717873f-a.text:
Broome St., fr. Crosby St. to Broadway
June 7, 1942
P. L. Sperr, photographer
Neg. No. A-829
717873f-a.folder: Broome Street & Crosby Street, Manhattan, NY

717874f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Crosby Street
717874f-a.text:
430 Broome Street (right), at the N.E. corner of Croaby Street
(left), showing a 5-story structure that was formerly a Masonic
Temple; Continental Lodge No. 287, F. \& A.M., New York City,meeting
here from 1855 to 1857 or 1858. It was the center of Masonic activities
and more Lodges metthere between 1850 and 1858 than at another point.
The Municipal Building Department states this to be the struoture
standing at that early date. The donator is Past Master and Historian
of the aforementioned Lodge and is also the present (1938) Secretary
of the Masonic Board of Relief of New York City.
1938.
Gift of Francis J. Arkins.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
717874f-a.folder: Broome Street & Crosby Street, Manhattan, NY

717875f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Crosby Street
717875f-a.text:
430-440 Broome Street, north side, east from and including
Crosby Street. No. 432 is a 3-story frame house.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 553.
CEEDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
